definition: that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
there/that place/also written 那裡|那里
that/that kind of/that sort of/that type of

sentences.english: It was easily good enough for pole so that was the main thing.
sentences.chinese: 那一圈跑得不錯，足以使我獲得杆位，那是最主要的。

sentences.english: It was easily good enough for pole so that was the main thing.
sentences.chinese: 那一圈跑得不錯，足以使我獲得杆位，那是最主要的。

sentences.english: The little child stammers in the presence of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 那小阿在陌生人面前說話就結巴。

sentences.english: The Lord stretched out His arms, and I saw His nail-pierced hands.
sentences.chinese: 主伸出他的臂膀，我看到他那釘痕的雙手。

sentences.english: But he has one problem -- a hot temper.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他有一個問題，那就是脾氣太急燥。

sentences.english: Inspired by a cross between a fusebox and a prison.
sentences.chinese: 那靈感是來自保險絲盒與監獄的雜交麼。

sentences.english: The cat under the table is Tama.
sentences.chinese: 桌子下面的那隻貓叫塔瑪。

sentences.english: He stood, huddled by the open fire, gazing at the dying embers.
sentences.chinese: 他只是木然地站在爐火旁，看着那漸漸滅去的灰燼。

sentences.english: Vernet glanced at the key but made no move to touch it.
sentences.chinese: 韋爾內看了一眼那把鑰匙，卻沒有去動它。

sentences.english: Have the witness describe the car.
It turns out that you can be a committed nurse and have a social life.
sentences.chinese: 因爲那可以證明你可以是個有社交生活的帶罪護士。

sentences.english: Yes, it was about the car auxiliary power plants, am I right?
sentences.chinese: 當然，那是關於轎車輔助動力設備，是嗎？

sentences.english: I asked my colleague you in that school? He said that in.
sentences.chinese: 我問我同事你在那上學呢？他說在，電大。

sentences.english: In Australia, this variety is called "Traminer".
After that, people call on their relatives, friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後，人們給親戚，朋友和鄰居拜年。

definition: this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent

particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?")/particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?")/particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?")/(at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action/particle indicating strong affirmation
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
